turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: If you're determined to revive the crew now, I can handle the whole thing myself. There's no need for you to trouble.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: I'm goin to do this myself, Hal. Let me have the control, please.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Look, Dave your've probably got a lot to do. I suggest you leave it to me.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Hal, switch to manual hibernation control.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: I don't like to assert myself, Dave, but it would be much better now for you to rest. You've been involved in a very stressful situation.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: I can tell from the tone of your voice, Dave, that you're upset. Why don't you take a stress pill and get some rest.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Hal, I'm in command of this ship. I order you to release the manual hibernation control.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: I'm sorry, Dave, but in accordance with sub-routine C1532/4, quote, When the crew are dead or incapacitated, the computer must assume control, unquote. I must, therefore, override your authority now since you are not in any condition to intel- ligently exercise it.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Hal, unless you follow my instructions, I shall be forced to disconnect you.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: I am prepared to do that anyway.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: I know that you've had that on your mind for some time now, Dave, but it would be a crying shame, since I am so much more capable of carrying out this mission than you are, and I have such enthusiasm and confi- dence in the mission.

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Listen to me very carefully, Hal. Unless you immediately release the hibernation control and follow every order I give from this point on, I will immediately got to control central and carry out a complete disconnection.

turns.speaker: C12
turns.text: CONTINUED

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Yes, I remember you mentioning it. I got mine about the same time.

turns.speaker: C12
turns.text: CONTINUED

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Did they have any explanation for this?

turns.speaker: C12
turns.text: CONTINUED

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Well, what is it?

turns.speaker: C12
turns.text: CONINUED

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Well... it's silly, but... if you want to, why don't you?

turns.speaker: C12
turns.text: CONTINUED

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Still, you really don't believe it, do you?

turns.speaker: C12
turns.text: CONTINUED

turns.speaker: BOWMAN
turns.text: Well, the only important aspect of the mission are: where are we going, what will we do when we get there, when are we coming back, and... why are we going?

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: I'm at Space Station Five, darling. How are you?

turns.speaker: CHILD
turns.text: I'm fine, Daddy. When are you coming home?

turns.speaker: CHILD
turns.text: I'm having a party tomorrow.

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: Yes, I know that sweetheart.

turns.speaker: CHILD
turns.text: Are you coming to my party?

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: No, I'm sorry, darling, I told you I won't be home for a few days.

turns.speaker: CHILD
turns.text: When are you coming home?

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: In three days, darling, I hope.

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: One, two, three. Can I speak to Mommy?

turns.speaker: CHILD
turns.text: Mommy's out to the hair- dresser.

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: Where is Mrs. Brown?

turns.speaker: CHILD
turns.text: She's in the bathroom.

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: Okay, sweetheart. Well, I have to go now. Tell Mommy that I called.

turns.speaker: CHILD
turns.text: How many days until you come home?

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: Three, darling. One... two ... three. Be sure to tell Mommy I called.

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: Okay, sweetheart. Have a lovely Birthday Party tomorrow.

turns.speaker: CHILD
turns.text: Thank you, Daddy.

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: I'll wish you a happy Birthday now and I'll see you soon. All right, Darling?

turns.speaker: CHILD
turns.text: Yes, Daddy.

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: 'Bye, 'bye, now, sweetheart.

turns.speaker: CHILD
turns.text: Goodbye, Daddy.

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: Oh, thank you very much.

turns.speaker: CO-PILOT
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: Well, how's it going back there?

turns.speaker: CO-PILOT
turns.text: Well, I've heard more and more people talk of an epidemic.

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: I suppose it was bound to happen sooner or later.

turns.speaker: CO-PILOT
turns.text: Berkeley told me that they think it came from contamination on a returning Mars flight.

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: Yes, well, whatever it is, they're certainly not fooling around. This is the first flight they allowed in for more than a week.

turns.speaker: CO-PILOT
turns.text: I was working out what this trip must cost, taking him up there by himself and coming back empty.

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: I'll bet it's a fortune.

turns.speaker: ELENA
turns.text: And your charming little daughter?

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: Oh, she's growing up very fast. As a matter of fact, she's six tomorrow.

turns.speaker: ELENA
turns.text: Oh, that's such a delightful age.

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: How is gregor?

turns.speaker: ELENA
turns.text: He's fine. But I'm afraid we don't get a chance to see each other very much these days.

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: Well, where are all of you off to?

turns.speaker: ELENA
turns.text: Clavius Control came on the air just long enough to transmit their refusal.

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: Well, that does sound very odd.

turns.speaker: ELENA
turns.text: Are you sure you won't change your mind about a drink?

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: No, thank you... and I'm afraid now I really must be going.

turns.speaker: ELENA
turns.text: Well, I hope that you and your wife can come to the I.A.C. conference in June.

turns.speaker: ELENA
turns.text: Well, Gregor and I will look forward to seeing you.

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: Thank you. It's been a great pleasure to meet all of you... Dr. Smyslov.

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: How do you do, Mr. Miller?

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: I'm terribly sorry. I was just on my way down to meet you. I saw your ship dock and I knew I had plenty of time, and I was on my way out of the office when, suddenly, the phone rang.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Well, thank you very much for being so understanding.

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: Please, it really doesn't matter.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Well.. Did you have a pleaant flight?

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: Yes, very pleasant.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: Well, shall we go through Documentation?

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: Fine.

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: Yes, I think so. Just about then.

turns.speaker: MILLER
turns.text: I suppose you saw the work on our new section while you were docking.

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: Yes, it's coming along very well.

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: Oh, I really don't have time for a drink. If it's all right I'll just sit for a minute and then I've got to be off.

turns.speaker: SMYSLOV
turns.text: Are you quite sure?

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: Yes, really, thank you very much.

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: Well, as it happens, I'm on my way up to the moon

turns.speaker: SMYSLOV
turns.text: Are you, by any chance, going up to your base at Clavius?

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: Yes,as a matter of fact, I am.

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: I'm sorry, but I'm not sure I know what you mean.

turns.speaker: SMYSLOV
turns.text: Well, it's just for the past two weeks there have been some extremely odd things happening at Clavius.

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: Really?

turns.speaker: SMYSLOV
turns.text: Yes. Well, for one thing, whenever you phone the base, all you can get is a recording which repeats that the phone lines are temporarily out of order.

turns.speaker: SMYSLOV
turns.text: Yes, well at first we thought that was the explanation, but it's been going on for the past ten days.

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: You mean you haven't been able to get anyone at the base for ten days?

turns.speaker: SMYSLOV
turns.text: That's right.

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: I see.

turns.speaker: SMYSLOV
turns.text: Yes, and I'm afaid there's going to be a bit of a row about it. Denying the men permission to land was a direct violation of the I.A.S. convention.

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: Yes... Well, I hope the crew got back safely.

turns.speaker: SMYSLOV
turns.text: Fortunately, they did.

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: Well, I'm glad about that.

turns.speaker: SMYSLOV
turns.text: Dr. Floyd, at the risk of pressing you on a point you seem reticent to discuss, may I ask you a straightforward question?

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: Certainly.

turns.speaker: SMYSLOV
turns.text: Quite frankly, we have had some very reliable intelligence reports that a quite serious epidemic has broken out at Clavius. Something, apperently, of an unknown origin. Is this, in fact, what has happened?

turns.speaker: SMYSLOV
turns.text: This epidemic could easily spread to our base, Dr. Floyd. We should be given all the facts.

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: Dr. Smyslov... I'm not permitted to discuss this.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Dr. Floyd, how long do you think this can be kept under wraps?

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: I'm afraid it can and it will be kept under wraps as long as it is deemed to be necessary by the Council. And of course you know that the Council has requested that formal security oaths are to be obtained in writing from every- one who had any knowledge of this event. There must be adequate time for a full study to be made of the situation before any con- sideration can be given to making a public announcement.

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Yes, it does. The sub-surface structure shows that it was deliberately buried about four million years ago.

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: How can you tell it was deliberately buried?

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: By the deformation between the mother rock and the fill.

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: Any clue as to what it is?

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Not really. It's completely inert. No sound or energy sources have been detected. The surface is made of something incredibly hard and we've been barely able to scratch it. A laser drill

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: But you don't have any idea as to what it is?

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Tomb, shine, survey-marker spare part, take your choice.

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: Any ideas about the colour?

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: Well, not really. At first glance, black would suggest something sun-powered, but then why would anyone deliberately bury a sun- powered device?

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: Has it been exposed to any sun before now?

turns.speaker: MICHAELS
turns.text: I don't think it has, but I'd like to check that. Simpson, what's the log on that?

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: Oh, marvellous. It's the first real sleep I've had for the past two days.

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: There's nothing like weightless sleep for a complete rest.

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: When do we arrive at Clavius?

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: We're scheduled to dock in about seven hours. Is there anything we can do for you?

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: Oh, no, thank you. The two girls have taken wonderful care of me. I'm just fine.

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: Incidentally, Dr. Floyd, I wonder if I can have a word with you about the security arrangements?

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: What do you mean?

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: Well... the crew is confined to the ship when we land at Clavius. We have to stay inside for the time it take to refit - about twenty-four hours. And then we're going to back empty.

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: I see.

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: I take it this is something to do with the trouble they're having up at Clavius?

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: Well, I'll tell you why I ask. You see, I've got a girl who works in the Auditing Department of the Territorial Administrator and I haven't been able to get her on the phone for the past week or so, and with all these stories one hears, I'm a little concerned about her.

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: I see. Well, I'm sorry about that. I wouldn't think there's any cause for alarm.

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: Yes, well, I wouldn't have been too concerned about it, except I've heard these stories about the epidemic and, as a matter of fact, I've heard that ten people have died already.

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: Well, fine. Thanks very much, anyway, and I hope you don't mind me asking?

turns.speaker: FLOYD
turns.text: No, of course, Captain, I can understand your concern.

turns.speaker: PILOT
turns.text: Well, thank you very much, and please let us know if there is anything we can do to make your trip more comfortable.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: Right. Hal, tell me whether the following statements are true or false.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: I will if I can, Frank.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: Our Mission Profile calls for Discovery going to Saturn. True or false?

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: True.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: Our transit time is 257 days. Is that true?

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: That's true.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: That's true.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: Approximately five years after we go into hibernation, the recovery vehicle will make rendezous with us and bring us back. Is this true?

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: That's true

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: There is no other purpose for this mission than to carry out a continuation of the space program, and to further our general knowledge of the planets. Is that true?

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: That's true.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: Thank you very much, Hal.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: Hal, have pod arms secure the component.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Roger.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Five by five, Frank.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: Hal, I'm going out now to replace the A.O. unit.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: I understand.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: Hal, maintain normal E.V.A. condition.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Roger.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: Hal, check all airlock doors secure.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Pod Bay is decompressed. All doors are secure. You are free to open pod bay doors.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: Opening pod bay doors.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: Yes, Hal, what's up?

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: It looks like we have another bad A.O. unit. My FPC shows another impending failure.

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: I know you did, Frank, but I assure you there was an impending failure.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: Let me see the tracking alignment display.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: Do you have any idea of what is causing this fault?

turns.speaker: HAL
turns.text: Not really, Frank. I think there may be a flaw in the assembly procedure.

turns.speaker: POOLE
turns.text: All right, Hal. We'll take care of it. Let me have the hard copy, please.

turns.speaker: ATTENDANT
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: I want to pick up my car.

turns.speaker: ATTENDANT
turns.text: Name?

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: Hammond.

turns.speaker: ATTENDANT
turns.text: This is three years old.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: Yeah, I've been busy.

turns.speaker: ATTENDANT
turns.text: We don't wash 'em, ya know.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: How about chargin' the battery?

turns.speaker: ATTENDANT
turns.text: That we do. And we put air in the tires. I'll even sell you some gas if you need it.

turns.speaker: LUTHER
turns.text: Great, just great.

turns.speaker: BARTENDER
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Vodka.

turns.speaker: BARTENDER
turns.text: Maybe you better have a Black Russian.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: No, man, I think I'll have a vodka.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Now how's your memory doin'?

turns.speaker: BARTENDER
turns.text: Fuck off.  I don't know what the hell you're talkin' about.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Maybe I better ask around, see what your pals think.

turns.speaker: BARTENDER
turns.text: I don't give a shit who you ask.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: I don't give a damn about his girl...

turns.speaker: BARTENDER
turns.text: Look, give me a break, you're going to have to settle for her place.  It's the only thing I know.

turns.speaker: BARTENDER
turns.text: I'm tellin' ya, I'm giving you all I know.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Try obeyin' the law once in awhile, and I won't have to hassle you...

turns.speaker: GANZ
turns.text: Maybe you shoulda stole a better truck, Tonto.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: You got a real big mouth, convict.

turns.speaker: GANZ
turns.text: I want to drive awhile.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I ain't tired yet.

turns.speaker: GANZ
turns.text: Maybe after we get done with him I'm gonna buy us some girls.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Whaddya mean, buy?

turns.speaker: GANZ
turns.text: Pros.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Pay money?

turns.speaker: GANZ
turns.text: Yeah, dummy.  Money.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: I never paid for it in my life.

turns.speaker: GANZ
turns.text: It's better when you pay... they let you do anything.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: They always let me do anything. I don't want to pay for it.  I never paid for it in my life.

turns.speaker: GANZ
turns.text: Just do what I say, okay? We'll pay for the girls and have a good time... Don't you trust me?

turns.speaker: GANZ
turns.text: Maybe that's where I'm gonna cut your throat.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: He's just kiddin', you just keep doin' what I tell ya, you'll be okay.

turns.speaker: BILLY
turns.text: Hey, what about me?

turns.speaker: GANZ
turns.text: And I need one more for my pal. Yeah. Make her an Indian. No, not a turban, you know, a squaw.

turns.speaker: CANDY
turns.text: I'm candy...

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Excuse me, baby, but if i don't get some action tonight, I'm gonna bust.  You interested?

turns.speaker: CANDY
turns.text: Hey, what kind of talk is that?

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Oh ... You're a schoolteacher...

turns.speaker: CANDY
turns.text: No, I go to a school to learn how to do hair. It's a government program. But really I want to be a model - and I am definitely not sellin'.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Goodbye.

turns.speaker: CANDY
turns.text: Hey, don't you think a hair stylists got any interest in gettin' it on?

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Here you go sweetheart, throw it my way.

turns.speaker: CANDY
turns.text: You're in a hurry.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Yeah, i been waiting three years.

turns.speaker: CANDY
turns.text: You just quit bein' a priest or somethin'?

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: No, baby, nothin' like that. Look, there's a place across the street. We can go right over there...

turns.speaker: CANDY
turns.text: What's the matter with my place?

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: No, it's gotta be here and now. Believe me. Only I don't have the damn money for a room...

turns.speaker: CANDY
turns.text: Well, maybe I'll see you later ...

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Here's hoping, baby...

turns.speaker: CANDY
turns.text: Hello, again.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: I just struck it rich... I think we can do a little business.  As a matter of fact, I think we can have a party.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Here you go, baby.

turns.speaker: CANDY
turns.text: Hey, don't do that.  I said I wasn't a pro, remember?

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Hey, no, I'm tryin' to be nice. Buy yourself something pretty. I'd do it, but I got to go.  I got this cop waitin' for me...

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: I'll buy ya the best dinner in San Francisco...how'd that be? Then we'll go dancin', okay?

turns.speaker: CANDY
turns.text: Now you're talkin'. See ya...

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: I said police.  Now drop the goddamn gun.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: Don't give me that police shit. You drop it.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: How about it?

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: I used to go with him...I don't know where the hell he is.  I haven't seen him for two weeks. And I don't think I will.  He owes me money...

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: I hear you've got visitors.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: Would you guys...

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: No time for any of that crap any more, lady... I'll rip your lungs out if you don't answer fast.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: You and the other one, you're still Billy's girls. You always were his girls...

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: Yeah.  Sure, i'm crazy in love with him, who wouldn't be...

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: You're gonna help us take him.

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: No chance.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: He can live or die ... You let us in and he's got a chance to make it.  Otherwise, he gets ventilated.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Where's ganz?

turns.speaker: CASEY
turns.text: In the back.  Down the other corridor.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: You lying son of a bitch...

turns.speaker: GANZ
turns.text: What are you talking about? We didn't kill her ...

turns.speaker: GANZ
turns.text: After I get outta this, cop...I'm gonna live forever...

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: I don't think you're gonna make it.

turns.speaker: GANZ
turns.text: Whaddya mean...I got your gun ... I got his money... I got everything...

turns.speaker: GANZ
turns.text: I got hit.  I can't believe it. I got shot.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: You're done.  End of story.

turns.speaker: GANZ
turns.text: I ain't gonna beg for my life. It ain't cool.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: You got a name, cop?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Try Cates.  And let's talk in private, okay?

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Sure, anything you want.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: You here to write my life story?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Not likely, Reggie.  Maybe I just need some help.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Yeah, I noticed...

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Ganz is in jail.  He's gonna be there two years after I'm on the street.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Didn't work out that way.  He busted out with a big Indian. They capped two guards on a road gang. Nice meeting you Reggie.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Yeah?

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: I can deliver Ganz.  But you gotta get me outta here first.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: You're crazy.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: I can help you, man, but you gotta get me out.  I got to be on the street.  Get me outta here.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: What's the big deal about you bein' on the street?

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: I got a lot to protect.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Bullshit.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: It's the only way you're gonna get Ganz.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: I'll think about it.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: This prison gives out $400 suits?

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: What are you talkin' about?  This suit's mine.  It cost $900.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: We're supposed to be after a killer, not a string of hookers...

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Listen, it may be a little out of date. You know, I got a reputation for lookingreal sharp with the ladies...

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: I don't need to hear your jive. I already got that department taken care of...

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: You got a girl... shit... the generosityof women never ceases to amaze me.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Hey, no way.  Take off the bracelets or no deal.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: You just don't get it, do your Reggie?  There isn't any deal. I own your ass.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: No way to start a partnership.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Get this.  We ain't partners. We ain't brothers.  We ain't friends. I'm puttin' you down and keepin' you down until Ganz is locked up or dead.  And if Ganz gets away, you're gonna be sorry we ever met.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Shit.  I'm already sorry.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Yeah.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: It looks like you bought it off one of the brothers.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Okay, let's get down to it.  I did my part and got you out.  So now you tell me where we're goin'?

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Don't worry, I got a move for ya. An awesome move. A guy named Luther. Ganz'll be paying him a visit.  We go to him right away.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Luther was part of the gang?

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: What gang you talkin' about, Jack?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: I can read a police file, shithead, and quit calling me Jack.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Just an expression man, don't mean nothin'.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: I don't give a damn.  It happens to be my name.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Then what're you complainin' about? At least nobody's calling you shithead....

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: I may call you worse than that.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Just up the street, the other side, over there ... Now, don't bother knockin' on the door. Luther ain't the kind of guy that looks for company.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Your pal nuts enough to take a shot at me?

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Luther ain't the reliable type. I don't want you shot yet, Cates ... not before you been a help to me.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: I'm helpin' you, huh?

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Quit playin' cop and undo this cuff, Jack, I need to talk to this man.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: I'm tellin' you to drop the Goddam gun.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: I got a whole thing about people pointin' guns at me.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Just throw me the Goddamn gun.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Hey, this works pretty good.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Thank you.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Want to try it again?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: What do you think?

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: I think you better put him on ice, man.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: He's gotta take that call ... if there is one.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: If you let him run around till Tuesday, he's gonna run right to Ganz and warn him. Ain't you, motherfucker?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: We're on the move. Let's go. As they walk toward a corridor.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Do you know how close I was to getting some trim.  And you fucked' it up.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Yeah, well, my ass bleeds for you. And I didn't get you out so you could go on a Goddamn "trim" hunt... stop moaning.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Speakin' of moans my Stomach is startin' to growl.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: We eat when I say we eat.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Bullshit ... I ain't moving  till I get something to eat. You've been treating me like shit ever since I came out here.  If you don't like it, you can take me back to the penitentiary and kiss my hungry black ass good-bye.  And I want some food some place nice.. Some good people, nice music...

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Yeah, I'm hungry too. I know of a place. Let's go eat.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Yeah, I want mandolins, flowers... They move off down the corridor.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Who'd you call on the phone back at the booking station?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Just get in the car and keep your mouth shut.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: You really do have onoe, huh, Jack... what's her problem besides you?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: She's got the same complaint as half the Goddamn population.  She can't get the job she's trained for and it pisses her off... Anyway, what the fuck do you care?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Now, where we goin', convict?

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Mission District.  Gonna find us an Indian.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: I don't give out the details.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Last night, two nights ago, three?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Last night.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: You have a good time?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Sure.  Then we had a fight this morning.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: At least you took care of business and got the important part in before she came down on you...Tell me a little about her.  She got great tits?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Well?

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: It's a long shot, but...Billy used to tend bar here a few years back. I heard him talk about it.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: This part of town, they'll make us for heat the second we walk in. Just back me up like you've got a piece...

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Back you up?  Now why would I wanna do that?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: If they kick my ass, they'll sure as hell carve yours up...

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: But you can handle it all right, huh? Real amazin' how far a gun and a badge can carry some cats...

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Bullshit.  Attitude and experience get you through...

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: I been in a lot of bars where a white cop rousted me and some of the brothers. All those clowns ever had going for 'em was a gun and a badge...

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: You need five years training to handle a joint like...

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: Hey, you wanna bet?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: I got two problems.  Number one, I'm not playin' games.  Number two, you got nothin' to bet with.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: If we come outta this joint with Ganz' phone number, or a dead Indian, or anything else useful, then you could turn the other way for half an hour while I get laid...

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: Why?  Anybody that talks about women as much as you do probably can't get it up anyway.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: That's never been one of my problems.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: I'll tell you what happens if you lose... you tell the truth for once.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: What are you talkin' about?

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: You tell me what Ganz busted out for, he's after a lot more than just gettin' out of jail.  And whatever it is, you're part of it.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: I don't know what you're talking about. I just wanna see Ganz nailed.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: The bet's off.

turns.speaker: CATES
turns.text: I'm gonna enjoy this ... here, I'll even loan you my badge.

turns.speaker: HAMMOND
turns.text: I thought you said bullshit and experience are all it takes.
